title: Internationals: Giroud, Koscielny, Xhaka
text:
Internationals: Giroud, Koscielny, Xhaka 
Four of our first-team squad were in international action on Saturday night - three representing their senior sides and one at Under-20 level. 
Read on to find out how they performed: 
Olivier Giroud scored twice - becoming one of France's top 10 goalscorers of all-time - and played the full 90 minutes in a 3-1 win at Luxembourg. The 30-year-old led the attack for Les Bleus and opened the scoring after 31 minutes. The visitors immediately responded with Aurelien Joachim converting from the penalty spot. Antoine Griezmann restored France's lead with a spot-kick of his own, before Giroud got his second goal of the game. Laurent Koscielny also played the full 90 minutes, but was denied a clean sheet as a result of Joachim's penalty. 
Olivier Giroud celebrates the opening goal against Luxembourg 
Granit Xhaka played the entirety of Switzerland's 1-0 win over Latvia. Granit lined up alongside Gelson Fernandes in central midfield, but it was former Borussia Monchengladbach team-mate, Josip Durmic, who scored the game's only goal. 
Granit Xhaka in action against Latvia 
Ainsley Maitland-Niles played the full 90 minutes as England Under-20s won 1-0 away against France. Adam Armstrong's strike in the 77th minute made the difference for the Three Lions. 
Ainsley Maitland-Niles representing England
